I always see people trying to fit a certain amount of things inside a chapter, like how manga have a certain number of pages in the magazine they're published.. but that's super limiting and can destroy how you want to tell the story.

uhhh. it's hard. I've always enjoyed stories that are self-explainatory. A lot of stories go with the monologue route, others jump you into a story with no knowledge at all
and both have their issues
For example; this is somesuch city, the so and so of the planet somesuch, etc.

but it's great to just.. go into a story without any kind of monologue, without any kind of text telling you what you're looking at... just something that you can see yourself.. see what it is, how things are
I just want to get the reader's feet wet without jumping right into the comic.
like a textless opening
